title: We Keep Finding More Black Friday Deals: 80+ Discounts to Check Out Now
description: CNET's shopping experts are keeping tally of the best sales as Black Friday turns into Cyber Monday at major retailers.
author: Adam Oram
excerpt: CNET's shopping experts are keeping tally of the best sales as Black Friday turns into Cyber Monday at major retailers.
text: Our expert, award-winning staff selects the products we cover and rigorously researches and tests our top picks. If you buy through our links, we may get a commission. Reviews ethics statement Adam Oram Senior Editor Adam Oram is a Senior Editor at CNET. He studied Media at Newcastle University and has been writing about technology since 2013. He previously worked as a Senior Writer at iMore, Deals Editor at Thrifter, and as an Apple Genius. His spare time is spent watching football (both kinds), playing Pokémon games, and eating vegan food. Expertise Deals | Apple CNET’s expert staff reviews and rates dozens of new products and services each month, building on more than a quarter century of expertise. This live blog is your go-to source for the latest and best deals uncovered by CNET's shopping experts. We've curated real bargains on TVs, laptops, gaming gear, and headphones, from steep discounts on our favorite TV for 2024 to smart home gadgets, the latest Airpods, and more. After thousands of hours of research and preparation, we're ready to guide you through the shopping season—but act fast, as these deals won't last long. We're constantly updating deals from top retailers like Amazon, Best Buy, Walmart, and others to bring you the best finds. Explore the list now and check back often for fresh updates!Best Black Friday deals The Google Pixel Buds Pro 2 are available in some gorgeous colors and support advanced features like smart adaptive sound, active noise cancellation and all-day battery life. The latest and greatest ebook reader from Amazon is good for a marathon reading session with its 12 weeks of battery life. Better still, the ebook reader has a refreshed display with even faster page turns and a perfect paper-like contrast ratio. It's the perfect reading companion.  This robot cleaner has 11,000 Pa of suction power and a built-in mop that automatically detects and avoids carpet. Plus, it uses advanced 3D mapping technology to avoid obstacles and generate the most efficient cleaning path for your home. It also has a 3.4L dust bin that can hold up to 90 days worth of debris. This laptop can handle almost anything you need. It has a 16-inch touchscreen display, an Intel Core i7 processor, 32GB of RAM and a whopping 1TB of storage. With an 11-inch Ultra Retina XDR display, an M4 chip, 256GB of storage and support for Wi-Fi 6E, this powerful Apple tablet is perfect for creatives. Be sure to clip the on-page coupon for the full discount. Cricut's biggest sale of the year has knocked a whopping $100 off this bundle, including one of our favorite, editor-tested Cricut machines. With 100 feet of RGBIC waterproof lights, you'll be able to give your home a makeover that you can personalize all year long. At 33% off, it's a great bet for Christmas, but it also has 100 scene modes, can handle pretty extreme temperatures from -4 degrees Fahrenheit up to 140 degrees Fahrenheit. Plus, it works with Alexa and Google Assistant, as well as the Govee Home app.  A 55-inch display is large enough for most spaces, and this particular model is equipped with an OLED screen. It also has Dolby Atmos sound, Dolby Vision, an A11 AI processor with upscaling and gaming features such as Nvidia G Sync, AMD FreeSync Premium and up to 144Hz refresh rate. Snag this TV while it's at an all-time low price.  Baseus Magsafe portable charger: $24 (save $36). Get this portable charger with a 10,000-mAh capacity and MagSafe design at a 50% discount, plus clip the extra 20% off on-page coupon. Govee TV backlight 3: $47 (save $23). This kit adds lights to the back of your TV that sync up with whatever you are watching or playing, and kits for multiple TV sizes are all discounted today.Govee RGBIC LED strip lights: $9 (save $6). Light up your space on a budget with Govee's light strips. You can control your new lights with an app on your phone or compatible smart assistants, like Alexa.Meta Quest 3S VR headset: $224 (save $299). Amazon is offering the latest Meta Quest headset at its usual $299 price but you'll get a free $75 Amazon gift card when you enter the discount code QUEST75 at checkout.Prusa MK4S 3D printer: $999 (save $100). One of the best 3D printers of 2024 is discounted by $100, and the top-rated MK4S also comes with $300 worth of free gifts.AncestryDNA + Traits genetic test kit: $40 (save $80). This genetic test kit will help you explore your origins, and personal characteristics. Best Black Friday TV dealsWe're very serious about TVs here at CNET, and the proud owners of a light-controlled TV Test Lab at our New York City office. As our shopping editors evaluate the best Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals on TVs, we cross-reference the discounts with the results of our rigorous hands-on testing — and consult our dedicated TV editors and writers, too. These are our favorites right now.  TCL/CNET The TCL QM8 offers superior brightness levels and top-notch picture quality thanks to its use of cutting edge mini-LED technology. No wonder it was our top pick for the best TV set of 2024.  Show more This smart TV defines "Go big or go home." It's 85 inches, making it almost too big for most spaces, but just right for those who love watching movies large and loud or like to catch all the details of any sport you can imagine. It's smarts come from Google TV and includes a subwoofer built-in to make the sound experience better in almost every case. With this Best Buy deal, you can upgrade your TV for $400 less this Black Friday. It even has Dolby Vision for film buffs and Nvidia G-Sync for gamers. Outdoor TVs are built differently compared to the wishy-washy indoor TVs. They have large surroundings that keep them from getting too hot or too cold, and they can withstand water splashes. This 43-inch 4K TV from Sylvox runs Google TV as well, so you can hang out on your deck and stream your favorite shows in the sunshine. Looking for the best picture quality on the market? Nab this Samsung TV with a 55-inch OLED glare-free display. It also has 4K AI upscaling capabilities, as well as HDR Pro, Dolby Atmos sound and Object Tracking Sound Plus. Hisense 65-inch CanvasTV: $800 (save $500). This TV has a matte screen to make it appear more like art than tech without sacrificing any of the smart tech to keep you streaming the good stuff.Roku Plus 75-inch QLED TV: $750 (save $150). This TV has an impressive 75-inch display and our favorite TV interface even without the substantial price drop.Sony 77-inch A80L OLED Google TV: $2,200 (save $800). Sony has the best color reproduction and this flagship OLED TV is great for watching movies at home.   Samsung 55-inch The Frame QLED TV: $898 (save $600). This 2024 TV with Dolby Atmos has an anti-reflection display to show off fine art when you're not using your TV.TCL 75-inch smart TV with Fire TV: $550 (save $200). Fire TVs are great if you live in an Alexa household and like to stream movies, and the TCL panels are excellent quality at this size.Toshiba 50-inch 4K TV: $190 (save $130). This affordable smart TV sports built-in Alexa functionality and supports Dolby Vision for excellent video quality. Hisense 55-inch ULED 4K smart TV: $650 (save $450). Hisense panels offer excellent color quality, and the 140Hz refresh rate gives a real boost to your gaming experience.  Best Black Friday smart home dealsBlack Friday is the perfect opportunity to upgrade your smart home setup, whether you're eyeing a security camera or multicolored light bulbs. CNET's experts have compiled the best deals you can find on gear that will help with everything from maintaining the ideal temperature to purifying the air you breathe. These high-tech essentials can often be pricey—but not when these rare deals come around. Whether for keeping an eye on your pets or kids, this indoor security camera is equipped with color night vision, 1080p HD video and it's half off. Show more Especially as we approach the winter months, this fourth-gen smart thermostat can help you save on your heating bill by optimizing the temperature of your home. Not to mention you can save $60 on it right now, too. Named the best air purifier, this smart device stays on top of allergens and pollutants by auto-adjusting to its environment. Breathe in cleaner air with $70 off the regular price. Amazon's Echo Show 8 is an impressive smart display with an 8-inch HD touchscreen, a 13MP camera and a built-in microphone to let you check the weather, set timers, update your calendar and more, hands-free. This bundle also includes a free Energetic smart bulb. Philips Hue A19 smart bulb (3-pack): $76 (save $59). Nab three impressive smart light bulbs in this multipack.Kasa smart LED light strip: $15 (save $10). Accent your home with the 16 million different colors of this smart light strip.  Aqara U100 smart door lock: $130 (save $100). This smart lock supports Apple's Home Key technology, Amazon's Alexa and more.Blink video doorbell: $30 (save $30). One of the best video doorbells of 2024, this Blink model is ultra-affordable and will help keep an eye on your doorstep or monitor package deliveries, all at half-off.SwitchBot automatic curtain 3 opener: $63 (save $27). Make mornings easier with this automatic curtain opener. The Curtain 3 works with Alexa, Google Home and HomeKit.Amazon Echo Pop: $18 (save $22). Amazon's smallest and most budget-friendly Alexa speaker just got cheaper. The Echo Pop is the perfect addition to any smart home, especially if you're just starting out.Ring Spotlight Cam Plus: $110 (save $70). This battery-enabled security camera includes a built-in spotlight for effective visibility at night. Best Black Friday headphone dealsA good pair of headphones, Airpods or wireless earbuds make relaxing with music easy. Top headphones and earbuds from top brands like Apple, Sony, Bose and more are on sale for Black Friday. We've gathered the best audio deals for you below across multiple big retailers, including Amazon, Best Buy and Walmart. Bose/CNET According to CNET's resident audio expert, the Bose QuietComfort earbuds offer "a lot to like for the price," and they're even more likable at $50 off. They boast solid sound quality that lives up to the Bose reputation, and the sleek, stemless design provides a snug, comfortable fit (for most people). Show more These super-popular ANC earbuds are $95 off right now. AirPods Pro 2 feature top-notch noise-cancelation, impressive sound quality and voice calling performance. They boast an IP54 weather-resistance rating and have a battery life of up to 30 hours with the charging case. If you want the sound quality of the AirPods Pro with the comfort and security of over-ear headphones, the AirPods Max are for you. The Beats Solo 4 are some of our favorite over-ear headphones. While they are not a noise-canceling model, they do support lossless audio. They also offer solid voice-call performance and have a substantial 50-hour battery life.  Anker Soundcore Space A40 ANC earbuds: $50 (save $50). Noise-canceling earbuds at half price? Yes, please. Just $50 gets you up to 50 hours of playtime total.JBL Tune 720BT headphones: $40 (save $40). These over-ear headphones deliver up to 76 hours of battery life per charge, have multipoint Bluetooth connectivity and fold for easy travel or storage.Bose QuietComfort Ultra headphones: $299 (save $130). The Bose flagship offers premium design, a new Immersive Audio feature for better sound quality, top-notch noise canceling and more.Beats Studio Pro x Kim Kardashian: $160 (save $190). The Beats Studio Pro headphones earned a spot on our list of the overall best headphones of the year thanks to their personalized spatial audio and lossless audio support, premium noise canceling, 6 built-in microphones and up to 40 hours of listening time per charge. This partnership with Kim Kardashian brings 3 new colors: Dune, Moon and Earth.Sennheiser Momentum 4: $230 (save $150). A premium pair of ANC headphones for serious audiophiles. These also made our best headphones list.Sony WH-1000XM5: $298 (save $102). Cut out the noise with Sony's flagship headphones. These headphones ranked as one of our favorite pair of headphones, making them an excellent choice. Edifier W820NB Plus: $52 (save $28). A favorite pair of headphones for 2024 thanks to their good sound quality and budget-friendly price tag.   Best Black Friday tech dealsBlack Friday sales are in full swing, and that means amazing tech deals. Whether you've been looking to get some electronics for your kid or just replace your outdated tech around the house, our Black Friday picks will have something for you. We've picked the best tech deals from top brands like Apple with great discounts on tablets, iPhones and other electronics across retailers like Amazon, Best Buy and Walmart. EF EcoFlow/CNET This 1,800-watt portable power station is great for backup power during inclement weather or wherever you go. It's at its lowest price ever right now. Show more DJI 2200W power station is ultra-silent, and includes a plethora of outlets to provide backup power. Moreover, it can even fast-charge drones like the DJI Mavic Air making it a great choice for photographers on the go.  Black Friday dropped the Ultra to the price it should've launched at. The latest Google Pixel Watch model comes in your choice of four different colors and you can also upgrade to the bigger 45mm version with the same $75 savings, too. Calling all gamers. If you're looking to get your hands on a new console, grab this deal that brings down Sony's Slim PS5 to the lowest price we've seen. UE's smallest, newest Bluetooth speaker gets its first big discount. While the Wonderboom usually wins Black Friday, the new Miniroll has stolen our hearts with its ultra-portable form factor and easy-to-mount backstrap. It can party all day (or night) with its 12-hour battery life, and UE finally used USB-C to charge the Miniroll, so no more digging out a micro-USB cable for this micro speaker. Each shade and series of Oura's third-gen ring gets lowest price yet. Not only does this HD monitor offer sharp image quality with a 1,920x1,080-pixel screen, but it also has adaptive sync. This means it matches up with the refresh rate of your graphics card in your computer, up to 120Hz. It's also very easy on the eyes, with a built-in blue light shield. Get the best Android smartwatch experience at its lowest price yet. Even if last year's Galaxy Watch 6 is down to $140, the improved health sensor array, the smoother yet more efficient processor and the new gesture controls on the Galaxy Watch 7 can make all the difference in the world in everyday use, especially for those with extra-small or irregularly shaped wrists. Samsung's Galaxy Health suite remains entirely free -- unlike Fitbit on the Pixel Watch 3 -- and its integration with both Samsung Galaxy phones and non-Samsung Android phones is top tier. Samsung's customizable watch faces, like the new Ultra Info Board or the updated (and GIF-supporting) Photos face, let your watch feel as futuristic, retro or personal as you desire. Blast 80W sound for almost $80 off with this wearable boombox. Soundcore's Motion line brought the noise this year with a slew of great Bluetooth speakers, but the Motion Boom Plus is perfect for bringing to the beach or to the gym when you're leading a yoga class thanks to its long, detachable strap. Its 13,400mAh battery can play 20 hours of music or play power bank to your phone or tablet. Take more than half off this travel-perfect dual port Spigen charger. Futureproof your "one cable" life with Anker's spiffiest cable deal. This 6-foot fast-charging cable is braided for durability and under 20 bucks right now. Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K Max: $33 (save $27). Give the gift of 4K streaming with the Fire TV Stick. It's the easiest way to add smart features to a nonsmart TV, especially if you're on a budget.Samsung Galaxy S24 (128GB): $660 (save $240). While we've seen this phone go for lower during October Prime Day, this is still a solid deal for Android users looking to upgrade.Belkin power bank: $20 (save $20). Get this portable charger with a 20,000-mAh capacity, a USB-C port and two USB-A ports at half price in either white, silver or rose gold.   Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses: $149 (save $150). These smart glasses can capture immersive video, record rich audio, music and even make calls. Clip the on-page coupon to get a $90 Amazon credit for the best deal.Sonos Ray: $169 (save $110). This compact soundbar will elevate your bedroom TV-watching experience.   Best Black Friday laptop and tablet dealsThere are tons of amazing Black Friday deals going on. Now is a great time to get a new laptop or Chromebook to replace your aging machine. There are plenty of laptop deals, whether you want a shiny gaming laptop, a reliable MacBook or a budget Chromebook for your kid. If you don't see something you like below, check our complete list of the best Black Friday laptop deals. And for those looking for something more portable, we've gathered great tablet deals that range from low-cost Fire tablets to price cuts on popular iPad models. Upgrading your laptop? This HP Pavilion Plus earned the overall top spot on our list of the best Windows laptops of 2024. It features a 14-inch, 2,560x1,600-pixel display, 512GB of storage and an Intel Core i5 processor. It's also equipped with multiple USB-C and USB-A ports, an HDMI port and a headphone jack for serious versatility. This Apple iPad alternative is a great value, and it's currently just $4 more than its lowest price ever. The newest Duet meets its lowest price yet for Black Friday. Just released last month, this MediaTek-powered Chrome OS tablet gets the long update life of a Chromebook — system and security updates until June 2034 — the flexibility of using both Android apps, Linux apps, and desktop-grade Chrome, and a 2K touchscreen that's perfect for reading 200 chapters of manga in a single setting. 12-hour battery life also means that you won't be reaching for a charger nearly as often as an Android tablet would be, either. This 2024 laptop has a touchscreen display, 16GB of RAM and 512GB of SSD storage. It also has the Snapdragon X Elite processor, AI capabilities through Copilot+ and gets up to 20 hours of battery life. Asus ROG Strix G16 gaming laptop: $1,100 (save $300). With a 16-inch display, Nvidia GeForce RTX 4060 graphics and 1TB of SSD storage, you can easily game on the go. Apple iPad Pro M2 (11-inch): $1,099 (save $400). This previous-gen tablet still packs a punch for creatives looking for a deal.Lenovo Legion Pro 5i gaming laptop: $1,500 (save $400). This gaming laptop has a 16-inch display, Nvidia GeForce RTX 4070 graphics, 32GB of RAM and 2TB of storage to handle all your gaming needs.Apple iPad (9th gen): $200 (save $130). This older model is still a good tablet for the basics, especially at this price.Amazon Fire HD 10: $75 (save $65). This tablet has a 10.1-inch display and is a great budget option for streaming content.HP Stream 14-inch BrightView laptop: $263 (save $136). A budget-friendly laptop from a well-known brand. The HP Stream comes with 16GB of RAM, 288GB storage and Office 365 access for a year.Samsung Galaxy Tab A9+ 11-inch tablet: $149 (save $71). This affordable Android tablet sports a large 11-inch display and quad speakers for an excellent multimedia experience.Best Black Friday home and kitchen dealsBlack Friday is the perfect time to upgrade your home and kitchen tools without spending a fortune. Whether you've been eyeing a new vacuum or thinking about finally getting that robot vacuum, we've rounded up the best deals for you below. And if you're hunting for budget-friendly options, don't miss our picks for the best Black Friday Deals Under $100 and Under $50. Chefman/CNET Add this indoor pizza oven to your kitchen arsenal and make personal 12-inch pizzas in just minutes. It has five presets, including a setting for pan pizza, so you can customize your pie exactly how you like it. This model also includes a pizza peel. Show more This cocktail maker will spice up your parties with over 40 craft recipes. Just insert a cocktail capsule, select drink strength, and you're ready to go.  The Breville Barista Express is our favorite espresso machine for making a cafe-quality latte at home. It has a built-in coffee grinder and steam wand for all of your caffeinated creations, and right now you can score a rare $200 discount. This all in one appliance is a air fryer, toaster and oven. It comes with an impressive 12 presets so no matter what you're making, it'll come out delicious. It goes up to 450 degrees and can fit 21 quarts so you won't have to worry about running out of room. We really recommend taking advantage of this first time deal.  Keep your food warm this holiday season with a warmer mat. Instead of warming things up in the microwave or oven every five minutes, place all your items on the mat so everything stay warm at the same time. And right now, it's back down to it's all time low price.  Blink Outdoor 4 security camera (3-pack): $100 (save $160, plus a free $20 gift card). The Blink Outdoor 4 has great battery life and it is one of our favorite wireless home security cameras of the year.Tineco Pure One S11 cordless vacuum cleaner: $180 (save $120). This lightweight Tineco was chosen as our pick for the overall best cordless vacuum of the year thanks to its strong suction, HEPA filtration and more. Clip the on-page coupon for the full discount.KitchenAid 5.5-quart Bowl-Lift stand mixer: $280 (save $170). Nothing beats a stand mixer. Add this classic to your kitchen arsenal to make cooking and baking easier.TheraGun Sense massage gun: $199 (save $100). This percussion massager can help tackle muscle soreness and pain. Nespresso Vertuo Pop+ espresso maker: $100 (save $60).. This limited-edition coffee maker looks fantastic on the countertop and can make delicious singles and doubles in a jiffy.Shark robot vacuum and mop combo: $350 (save $350). Hoover up the dirt, and mop up automatically with this robot vacuum cleaner.Nextmug temperature-controlled coffee mug: $90 (save $40). Keep your morning cup of coffee piping hot for hours on end.  Dyson Airwrap: $499 (save $100). This corded hair straightener can style your hair without using heat.When is Cyber Monday?Cyber Monday is scheduled to take place on Dec. 2 this year. The major sale event always takes place the first Monday after Thanksgiving is observed in the US, which is on the fourth Thursday of November each year. Between Black Friday -- which is the day after Thanksgiving -- and Cyber Monday, we see an uptick in sales, though in recent years, the shopping event has become a monthlong bonanzaWhen is Black Friday?Black Friday happened on Nov. 29 this year. It always lands the day after Thanksgiving in the US, which falls on the fourth Thursday of November. There are hundreds of price cuts and sizable sales from the biggest online retailers you can still snag right now.When did Black Friday sales end?Black Friday sales tend to last a few days after the major sales event itself, which was Nov. 29. this year. With this in mind, it's fair to assume offers will run throughout the weekend into early December. It will then be taken over by Cyber Monday on Dec. 2. Just note that the best deals are expected on the main Black Friday date.Are Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals only available online?Generally speaking, yes. The number of deals launching exclusively in stores has been dwindling in recent years, and this was certainly accelerated during COVID-19 when crowds were discouraged, and most shopping moved online. We've seen retailers like Walmart and Target previously offering online-only deals, whereas others like Best Buy extend their Black Friday savings to in-store locations as well. As for Cyber Monday, it has historically been a predominately online shopping event which is continuing on this year.Best Black Friday and Cyber Monday retailersAmazon: One of the biggest online retailers, Amazon has massive discounts with significant savings on tech, home appliances, and smart home equipment. Walmart: Save big on appliances like televisions, refrigerators, laptops, and more at Walmart's Black Friday and Cyber Monday event.Best Buy: Black Friday and Cyber Monday are historically a great time to buy TVs and Best Buy has you covered for that and more.The Home Depot: Eyeing home improvement tools? Home Depot has the best discounts on tools, appliances, and even grills.Target: Target may not be as big on Black Friday and Cyber Monday as other retailers but it does offer some great deals on toys, gifts and board games.Why are they called Black Friday and Cyber Monday?The term "black" has historically been used to denote distressing or calamitous events. The earliest known use of Black Friday for the Friday after Thanksgiving was to refer to the practice of workers calling in sick the day after Thanksgiving in the early 1950s. Around that same time, US police adopted the term to describe the traffic conditions during the first major holiday shopping date. After attempts to move to the term "Big Friday" failed, merchants attempted to ameliorate the term Black Friday in subsequent years, suggesting that its origin was not due to the terrible traffic the shopping spree created, but because the profit it generated put stores "back in the black" in financial terms. Then, in 2005, the National Retail Federation coined the term "Cyber Monday" because it had noticed a spike in online traffic the Monday following Thanksgiving. At the time, it was believed it was because people were making online purchases while they were at work following the holiday, so their kids couldn't see any gift purchases and because work computers typically had faster internet connections. There was some chatter about calling the date Black Monday or Blue Monday -- because hyperlinks are blue -- but eventually, everyone settled on the more futuristic-sounding Cyber Monday. In 2014, Cyber Monday became the biggest online shopping day in the country.

Our expert, award-winning staff selects the products we cover and rigorously researches and tests our top picks. If you buy through our links, we may get a commission.

Reviews ethics statement

Adam Oram Senior Editor

Adam Oram is a Senior Editor at CNET. He studied Media at Newcastle University and has been writing about technology since 2013. He previously worked as a Senior Writer at iMore, Deals Editor at Thrifter, and as an Apple Genius. His spare time is spent watching football (both kinds), playing Pokémon games, and eating vegan food.

Expertise Deals | Apple

CNET’s expert staff reviews and rates dozens of new products and services each month, building on more than a quarter century of expertise.

This live blog is your go-to source for the latest and best deals uncovered by CNET's shopping experts. We've curated real bargains on TVs, laptops, gaming gear, and headphones, from steep discounts on our favorite TV for 2024 to smart home gadgets, the latest Airpods, and more. 

After thousands of hours of research and preparation, we're ready to guide you through the shopping season—but act fast, as these deals won't last long. We're constantly updating deals from top retailers like Amazon, Best Buy, Walmart, and others to bring you the best finds. Explore the list now and check back often for fresh updates!

Best Black Friday deals

This laptop can handle almost anything you need. It has a 16-inch touchscreen display, an Intel Core i7 processor, 32GB of RAM and a whopping 1TB of storage.

Cricut's biggest sale of the year has knocked a whopping $100 off this bundle, including one of our favorite, editor-tested Cricut machines.

With 100 feet of RGBIC waterproof lights, you'll be able to give your home a makeover that you can personalize all year long. A 55-inch display is large enough for most spaces, and this particular model is equipped with an OLED screen. When is Cyber Monday?

Cyber Monday is scheduled to take place on Dec. 2 this year. The major sale event always takes place the first Monday after Thanksgiving is observed in the US, which is on the fourth Thursday of November each year. Between Black Friday -- which is the day after Thanksgiving -- and Cyber Monday, we see an uptick in sales, though in recent years, the shopping event has become a monthlong bonanza

When is Black Friday?

Black Friday happened on Nov. 29 this year. It always lands the day after Thanksgiving in the US, which falls on the fourth Thursday of November. There are hundreds of price cuts and sizable sales from the biggest online retailers you can still snag right now.

When did Black Friday sales end?

Black Friday sales tend to last a few days after the major sales event itself, which was Nov. 29. this year. With this in mind, it's fair to assume offers will run throughout the weekend into early December. It will then be taken over by Cyber Monday on Dec. 2. Just note that the best deals are expected on the main Black Friday date.

Are Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals only available online?

Generally speaking, yes. The number of deals launching exclusively in stores has been dwindling in recent years, and this was certainly accelerated during COVID-19 when crowds were discouraged, and most shopping moved online. We've seen retailers like Walmart and Target previously offering online-only deals, whereas others like Best Buy extend their Black Friday savings to in-store locations as well. As for Cyber Monday, it has historically been a predominately online shopping event which is continuing on this year.

Best Black Friday and Cyber Monday retailers

  • Amazon: One of the biggest online retailers, Amazon has massive discounts with significant savings on tech, home appliances, and smart home equipment. 
  • Walmart: Save big on appliances like televisions, refrigerators, laptops, and more at Walmart's Black Friday and Cyber Monday event.
  • Best Buy: Black Friday and Cyber Monday are historically a great time to buy TVs and Best Buy has you covered for that and more.
  • The Home Depot: Eyeing home improvement tools? Home Depot has the best discounts on tools, appliances, and even grills.
  • Target: Target may not be as big on Black Friday and Cyber Monday as other retailers but it does offer some great deals on toys, gifts and board games.

Why are they called Black Friday and Cyber Monday?

The term "black" has historically been used to denote distressing or calamitous events. The earliest known use of Black Friday for the Friday after Thanksgiving was to refer to the practice of workers calling in sick the day after Thanksgiving in the early 1950s. Around that same time, US police adopted the term to describe the traffic conditions during the first major holiday shopping date. 

After attempts to move to the term "Big Friday" failed, merchants attempted to ameliorate the term Black Friday in subsequent years, suggesting that its origin was not due to the terrible traffic the shopping spree created, but because the profit it generated put stores "back in the black" in financial terms. 

Then, in 2005, the National Retail Federation coined the term "Cyber Monday" because it had noticed a spike in online traffic the Monday following Thanksgiving. At the time, it was believed it was because people were making online purchases while they were at work following the holiday, so their kids couldn't see any gift purchases and because work computers typically had faster internet connections. There was some chatter about calling the date Black Monday or Blue Monday -- because hyperlinks are blue -- but eventually, everyone settled on the more futuristic-sounding Cyber Monday. In 2014, Cyber Monday became the biggest online shopping day in the country.
